text:
Hey guys ,
i have TestDB.db file in my assest folder,  
Now whenever i am running my application I am copying it into particular device.
Its get connected properly with TestDB.db but it give me   this error
"android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such table test , while compiling"  but the fact is that i have "test" table in TestDB.db.

hi guys, i have questions:
1) is there a way that i can update a recyclerview’s adapter in a fragment from a different fragment? or 
2) can I update the adapter after using a popBackStack to that fragment? 
thanks!

<@U0G47NBQV>: 
1) you should be able to if the adapter is in the activity hosting the fragments.
2) just notifydatasetchangedfor the adapter in the fragment's oncreateview
ah by 1) the adapter is in another fragment. So i guess i should stick with the notifydatasetchanged instead.
<@U0G47NBQV> you could shift it to the activity

Hi guys!
How do I share to Facebook from my app, for users without the Facebook app installed on their device?
<@U0NQ6CY8G> the max you can do is have the user copy all the content that you wish to share, make an intent to the browser and open Facebook
another way to do it is by using facebook login api, I haven’t really followed up with the updated apis, check whether they let you share now

<@U25CTHVN0>:  check again database...it's showing table's row or col. is missing
although it shows testDb.db
the facebook sdk should automatically redirect to browser if the fb app isnt installed on the phone
